oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Lives, adventures, anecdotes, amusements, and domestic habits of the Siamese twins

Lives, adventures, anecdotes, amusements, and domestic habits of the Siamese twins: one of the greatest wonders of the present time, being two perfectly formed persons, whose bodies, by a singular caprice of nature, are united together as one.

oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A brief account of the twins' travels, marriage, and settlement on a farm in Surry County, North Carolina. Published in Raleigh, N.C. in 1850

oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: History of the siamese youths, united twins:

History of the siamese youths, united twins: Containing a full description of their birth, formation, habits, etc., with curious and interesting anecdotes, to which are subjoined the scientific statements of Drs. Mitchell, Warren, and Sir A. Carlisle.

oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: An Account of money received by Chang-Eng
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Title supplied by repository
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bunker, Chang, 1811-1874.; Bunker, Eng, 1811-1874.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Account book of Chang and Eng Bunker kept during their travels across the United States, Canada, and Europe from 1833 to 1839. The book provides a day by day record of the twins' whereabouts and the income they received at each location. Cities visited include: New York City, Philadelphia, Quebec, Montreal, Paris, The Hague, Amsterdam, and many other smaller towns and locales.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Bunker, Chang, 1811-1874.; Bunker, Eng, 1811-1874.

oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Contract between Edmund H. Doty and Chang and Eng Bunker
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Title supplied by repository

An incomplete or draft version of the terms of agreement between Edmund H. Doty and the Bunkers for a travelling exhibition beginning in April 1849. The Bunkers agreed to exhibit themselves and two of their children for eight months under Doty's employ for the sum of $8,000. Terms of the contract also include accommodations, length of the exhibits, and an option to extend the exhibition period to twelve months.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Bunker, Chang, 1811-1874.; Bunker, Eng, 1811-1874.;
Conjoined twins.; Abnormalities, Human.; Traveling exhibitions--United States.; Contracts.;

oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Library. Southern Historical Collection.;
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:identifier: Contract between Edmund H. Doty and Chang and Eng Bunker, 1849, Chang and Eng Bunker Papers #3761, Southern Historical Collection, Wilson Library, University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.

oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Account of Chang and Eng Bunker with T. F. Prather, Mt. Airy, N.C.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Title supplied by repository

Statement of the Bunkers' purchases from T. F. Prather from January to October 1855. Goods purchased by the twins include: clothing, food, spices, tobacco, gunpowder, wagons, harnesses, tools, and other household items.
